Posts.Content: Sep 12, 2012 04:01AM Dariff wrote: Hello fellow Texan~\  I think you are over worrying...but just to make sure; ask your gyno or family doctor.  DO NOT worry your daughter needlessly.  You will cause needless worry on her part and yours. I have breast cancer now and my daughter is 35.  But she is a long distant runner which LOWERS her risk for bc.  She knows how to lower her risk for BC and is doing it.  Because I have a grandaughter as well, just make sure your daughter knows how to "help" prevent BC and is healthy. D
Posts.Title: Daughter checking herself txmomof2 farmerlucy
